channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2023090430
item.description:
Report X-2023090430

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 5-gallon jerrican of Quartz Fully Body Protectant infused with Graphene Oxide was leaking out of a defective lid. The lid was secured but was still leaking out of it. Content display flammable liquid & corrosive diamond but outer packaging doesn't have any hazmat markings. Package was shipped as normal package. DescribePack: Jerrican was leaking due to defective lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Steel drum had been found open and wet. inspection found that 1 drum of Luster Seal 350 had been dented and had a loose lid causing leakage, DescribePack: 1 drum of Luster Seal 350 had been dented and had a loose lid causing leakage, DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in Hazmat lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090426
item.description:
Report X-2023090426

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 1 jerrican of ZeroTol 2.0 2.5-gallon was leaking out of a defective lid. Jerrican was wrapped in black plastic wrap & styrofoam that covered a oxidizer & corrosive diamond. Outer box didn't display any hazmat markings. Was shipped as normal package. DescribePack: Bottle was leaking out of a defective lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2023090723
item.description:
Report E-2023090723

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: MILTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 14, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1824 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. Crews patched and placed the damaged 55-gallon drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon overpack to be staged onsite for further evaluation. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads to collect any residual product.

item.title: Report X-2023090270
item.description:
Report X-2023090270

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was received as an "Undeclared" Hazmat pkg. from 381-MEMP. When an Ops. Manager was helping remove the pkg. from the conveyer belt because it was heavy, a bottle came out, fell on the ground, and the cap was loose, causing the liquid to splatter on the manager. Liquid got on his legs, arm, and a couple of drops on his face; burned and caused small blisters for a short period. Individual was taken to the shower when he showered the liquid off his body and clothes. DescribePack: Pkg. not well taped, cause a bottle to fall out which happened to have a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed in a 20 gallon container awaiting instructions from PGH, they have been contacted prior to report.

item.title: Report E-2023090673
item.description:
Report E-2023090673

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T00:33:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023 at 1450 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in St. Petersburg, Florida regarding the release of approximately (50) gallons of Polyester Resin Solution in Styerne ( Resin Solution, UN1866, 3, lll ) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was caused by a puncture to the drum and contained to the trailer floor. The Terminal personnel were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste from this release will also be managed by terminal personnel for proper disposal.
